body_html:
Don't worry about it for this patch, but in the long run we should switch over to hashes which aren't broken (sha256, for instance).
…
On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 3:41 PM Yifei Feng ***@***.***> wrote: ***@***.**** commented on this pull request. ------------------------------ In tensorflow/workspace.bzl <#7953 (comment)> : > @@ -418,15 +418,15 @@ def tf_workspace(path_prefix = "", tf_repo_name = ""): ) # Make junit-4.12 available as //external:junit - native.http_jar( - name = "junit_jar", - url = "https://github.com/junit-team/junit4/releases/download/r4.12/junit-4.12.jar", - sha256 = "59721f0805e223d84b90677887d9ff567dc534d7c502ca903c0c2b17f05c116a", + native.maven_jar( + name = "junit_junit", + artifact = "junit:junit:4.12", + sha1 = "2973d150c0dc1fefe998f834810d68f278ea58ec", I followed the example on bazel doc https://bazel.build/versions/master/docs/be/workspace.html#maven_jar Do we not need the sha1 here? — You are receiving this because you commented. body_text:
Don't worry about it for this patch, but in the long run we should switch
over to hashes which aren't broken (sha256, for instance).
…
On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 3:41 PM Yifei Feng ***@***.***> wrote:
 ***@***.**** commented on this pull request.
 ------------------------------

 In tensorflow/workspace.bzl
 <#7953 (comment)>
 :

 > @@ -418,15 +418,15 @@ def tf_workspace(path_prefix = "", tf_repo_name = ""):
    )

    # Make junit-4.12 available as //external:junit
 -  native.http_jar(
 -      name = "junit_jar",
 -      url = "https://github.com/junit-team/junit4/releases/download/r4.12/junit-4.12.jar",
 -      sha256 = "59721f0805e223d84b90677887d9ff567dc534d7c502ca903c0c2b17f05c116a",
 +  native.maven_jar(
 +      name = "junit_junit",
 +      artifact = "junit:junit:4.12",
 +      sha1 = "2973d150c0dc1fefe998f834810d68f278ea58ec",

 I followed the example on bazel doc
 https://bazel.build/versions/master/docs/be/workspace.html#maven_jar
 Do we not need the sha1 here?

 —
 You are receiving this because you commented.
 Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
 <#7953 (comment)>,
 or mute the thread
 <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAETb5c_WM93F1Sf6wTf859phR284gVkks5rhLCWgaJpZM4MPBHD>

body:
Don't worry about it for this patch, but in the long run we should switch
over to hashes which aren't broken (sha256, for instance).
On Tue, Feb 28, 2017 at 3:41 PM Yifei Feng <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> *@yifeif* commented on this pull request.
> ------------------------------
>
> In tensorflow/workspace.bzl
> <https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/7953#discussion_r103579170>
> :
>
> > @@ -418,15 +418,15 @@ def tf_workspace(path_prefix = "", tf_repo_name = ""):
>    )
>
>    # Make junit-4.12 available as //external:junit
> -  native.http_jar(
> -      name = "junit_jar",
> -      url = "https://github.com/junit-team/junit4/releases/download/r4.12/junit-4.12.jar",
> -      sha256 = "59721f0805e223d84b90677887d9ff567dc534d7c502ca903c0c2b17f05c116a",
> +  native.maven_jar(
> +      name = "junit_junit",
> +      artifact = "junit:junit:4.12",
> +      sha1 = "2973d150c0dc1fefe998f834810d68f278ea58ec",
>
> I followed the example on bazel doc
> https://bazel.build/versions/master/docs/be/workspace.html#maven_jar
> Do we not need the sha1 here?
>
> —
